actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to define the term reasonable allowance for salaries or other compensation with respect to certain highly compensated employees of publicly traded corporation, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide that, with respect to compensation for certain highly compensated employees of publicly traded corporations, reasonable allowance for salaries or other compensation for personal services actually rendered for purposes of the trade or business expense deduction includes only the first $500,000. Excludes certain benefits from such compensation.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to define the term reasonable allowance for salaries or other compensation with respect to certain highly compensated employees of publicly traded corporation, and for other purposes.
